results.name: (1/3) * ((A007318^2 - A007318^(-1)).
comment: Left border = A001045: (1, 1, 3, 5, 11, 21, 43, 85,...). Row sums = (1, 3, 9, 27,...). Analogous triangles for other powers of P are: A131047, A131049, A131050 and A131051.
formula: Let A007318 (Pascal's triangle) = P. then A131048 = (1/3) * (P^2 - 1/P). Delete right border of zeros.

O.g.f.: 1/(1-(2x+1)*t+(x^2+x-2)*t^2) = 1+(1+2x)*t+(3+3x+3x^2)*t^2+ ... . T(n,n-k) = (1/3)*C(n,k)*(2^k - (-1)^k) = C(n,k)*A001045(k). The row polynomials R(n,x):= sum {k = 0..n} T(n,n-k)*x^(n-k) = (1/3)*((x+2)^n-(x-1)^n) and have the divisibility property R(n,x) divides R(m,x) in the polynomial ring Z[x] if n divides m. The polynomials R(n,-x), n >= 2, satisfy a Riemann hypothesis: their zeros lie on the vertical line Re x = 1/2 in the complex plane. Compare with A094440. - _Peter Bala_, Oct 24 2007
